title: How to Tie Dye Long Sleeve Shirts

steps.title: Buy bottles of dye at your local fabric or craft store.
steps.content: Buy bottles of dye at your local fabric or craft store. Bottles are much easier to use than mixed dye, because you can apply them more exactly to sections of the shirt. If you want a rainbow tie-dye shirt, look for a kit that contains all the shirts you need. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Read your tie-dye instructions to see if you need to use soda ash to fix the dye, or if it can be used without soaking.
steps.content: Read your tie-dye instructions to see if you need to use soda ash to fix the dye, or if it can be used without soaking. Purchase soda ash, or washing soda that is made of sodium carbonate. Purchase rubber bands.

steps.title: Lay a plastic drop cloth on your table.
steps.content: Lay a plastic drop cloth on your table. It will protect the table, but it also allows the t-shirt to be wrapped more easily. Keep a plastic bag and a bucket nearby so that you can transport your shirt to the laundry room. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Practice the wrapping process while the shirt is dry.
steps.content: Practice the wrapping process while the shirt is dry. Then, you can repeat with a shirt soaked in soda ash and water.

steps.title: Smooth out the shirt on the plastic drop cloth.
steps.content: Smooth out the shirt on the plastic drop cloth. Move the tips of the long sleeves so that they are gathered next to the body of the shirt. Try to keep them close if you want them to form a pattern with the rest of the shirt. Keep them separate if you want a different pattern on the sleeves than the body of the tee.

steps.title: Find the imaginary line that connects the two armpits through the center of the shirt.
steps.content: Find the imaginary line that connects the two armpits through the center of the shirt. Pinch the shirt in the middle of that line, in the center of the chest. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Twist the shirt.
steps.content: Twist the shirt. The shirt will start to form a spiral. Use your other hand to continue twisting the shirt. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Feather the shirt before you finish your round spiral.
steps.content: Feather the shirt before you finish your round spiral. This means that you will create extra lines, or folds, in the shirt between each turn.

steps.title: Make sure that the long sleeves travel along the length of the body as you make your spiral.
steps.content: Make sure that the long sleeves travel along the length of the body as you make your spiral.

steps.title: Stop when you’ve made a tight spiral that is in the shape of a circle.
steps.content: Stop when you’ve made a tight spiral that is in the shape of a circle. Take rubber bands and open them with your hands. Slide them under and over the circle until they are tight on opposite ends. Avoid picking the shirt bundle up, since it can change the shape you’ve created. Instead, slide the rubber bands across the drop cloth.

steps.title: Secure the circle with rubber bands going perpendicular.
steps.content: Secure the circle with rubber bands going perpendicular. Then, do diagonal lines. The end result will look like it has several pizza slices. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat with a shirt soaked in a mixture of soda ash and water.
steps.content: Repeat with a shirt soaked in a mixture of soda ash and water. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Put on some food preparation gloves before you start to handle the dye.
steps.content: Put on some food preparation gloves before you start to handle the dye.

steps.title: Tip the first dye bottle upside down.
steps.content: Tip the first dye bottle upside down. Apply just enough dye to soak the fabric in a pie slice-section, but not to create excess dye on your drop cloth. When in doubt, use less dye.

steps.title: Follow with colors of the rainbow to blend.
steps.content: Follow with colors of the rainbow to blend. You can also alternate colors to create a color-blocked spiral. Repeat until you’ve dyed all the pie sections. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Flip the shirt over onto its backside.
steps.content: Flip the shirt over onto its backside. Repeat the process of applying bottle dye to each section. Match up the right color from the front with the color on the back. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Place the shirt inside a plastic bag.
steps.content: Place the shirt inside a plastic bag. Let it sit according to the dye instructions. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Soak the shirt in cold water after it has sat for enough time.
steps.content: Soak the shirt in cold water after it has sat for enough time. Remove the rubber bands.

steps.title: Run the shirt through two cold water cycles in the washing machine.
steps.content: Run the shirt through two cold water cycles in the washing machine. Do not use soap.

steps.title: Place it in the dryer on medium heat.
steps.content: Place it in the dryer on medium heat. It will help to set the dye further. Your shirt is ready to wear or wash as desired. [10] X Research source
